symbols.name: sap.ui.comp
symbols.description:
SAPUI5 library with smart controls.
Note: The controls in this library only support OData V2 (see {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel}) and a default model (named undefined).
Note: Properties of a complex type (used in an OData entity type) cannot be bound by or used with controls of this library.
Note: Most controls in this library do not support key user adaptation. Please see {@link topic:f1430c0337534d469da3a56307ff76af Key User Adaptation: Enable Your App} for a list of supported controls.

symbols.description: The FilterControlConfiguration can be used to generate the dynamic date range control used for filtering the smart table.

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.config.ControlConfigurationBase#constructor sap.ui.comp.config.ControlConfigurationBase} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar
symbols.description: The FilterBar displays filters in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The FilterBar consists of a row containing the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement SmartVariantManagement} control, the related buttons, and an area underneath displaying the filters. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide FilterBar / Show FilterBar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Adapt Filters button shows the Adapt Filters Dialog. In this dialog, the user has full control over the FilterBar.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data. Only if the persistencyKey is provided, will the VariantManagement control be used.

properties.name: advancedMode
properties.description: The advanced mode is only relevant for the value help scenario. UI representation is different from the standard FilterBar.

properties.name: expandAdvancedArea
properties.description: Collapses/expands the advanced area.

deprecated.text: Replaced by property filterBarExpanded This property is mapped to the filterBarExpanded property.

properties.name: searchEnabled
properties.description: Enables/disables the Search button.

properties.name: filterBarExpanded
properties.description: Shows the filters area. When property useToolbar is set to false, filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note: When SmartFilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog, it is initially collapsed. The filter bar is initially expanded in the following cases: - When there is no basic search field. - When preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog is set to true or the fetchValues property of the valueList annotation is set to 2. - When there are mandatory fields, all fields are expanded (not only the first 7).

properties.name: considerGroupTitle
properties.description: If this property is set, then the label for filters will be prefixed with the group title.

properties.name: showAllFilters
properties.description: If set to true, when the FilterBar is expanded it will show all filters, not only the first 7. Note: This is valid only when the FilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog

properties.name: showClearButton
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Clear button on the Filters dialog.

deprecated.text: with no replacement. Users can select any Variant instead.

properties.name: showRestoreButton
properties.description: Handles visibility of the "Restore" button on the "Filters" dialog. Note: Restore works only automatically when a property persistencyKey is set and therefore Variant Management is used. In all other cases the "restore" behavior needs to be implemented by the app, based on the event reset. Since 1.84 the "Restore" button text is changed to "Reset"

properties.name: showGoOnFB
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Go button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: showRestoreOnFB
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Restore button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: showClearOnFB
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Clear button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: showGoButton
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Go button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: deltaVariantMode
properties.description: Stores the delta as compared to the standard variant.

properties.name: filterContainerWidth
properties.description: Sets the width of the filters container.

properties.name: useToolbar
properties.description:
Determines what design is used. Default is the design with toolbar. If the property useToolbar is set to false, the property filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note:
If set to false, the VariantManagement control is not available at all. This scenario is only intended for the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar}.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the toolbar on the first position. This property is ignored, when useToolbar is set to false.

properties.name: showFilterConfiguration
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Filters button on the FilterBar.

properties.name: useSnapshot
properties.description:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

properties.name: isRunningInValueHelpDialog
properties.description: Sets whether the filter bar should look like the filters area in a ValueHelpDialog. True for SmartFilterBar when used in a ValueHelpDialog. False otherwise.

properties.name: disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning
properties.description: Disables the warning for special symbols. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description: Specifies the semantic header level of the {@link #getHeader header} text property. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}. This property is ignored, when useToolbar is set to false.

aggregations.name: filterItems
aggregations.description: Filters belonging to the basic group.

aggregations.name: filterGroupItems
aggregations.description:
Contains all FilterBar filters.
Note:In case a filter has to be added to the basic group
  • the property groupName has to be set to the constant sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.INTERNAL_GROUP
  • the property groupLabel will be handled internally and will be ignored, if set
  • the property partOfCurrentVariant has to be set to true
  • if the property visibleInFilterBar is set to true, the property partOfCurrentVariant will be set internally also to true

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Do NOT use this aggregation directly. The FilterBar control is not meant to be used with arbitrary content. It renders filterFields which are added by filterGroupItems aggregation. If you need to add some content below the FilterBar, this can be done by adding it as sibling of the FilterBar. For example, if FilterBar is child of DynamicPageHeader, the custom content can be added to the DynamicPageHeader as well.

aggregations.name: _parameters
aggregations.description: Special handling for analytic parameters.

associations.name: basicSearch
associations.description: Populates the basic search area on the FilterBar and the Filters dialog.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event is fired when the Cancel button on the Filters dialog is pressed and the variant is marked as dirty.

events.name: reset
events.description: This event is fired when the Restore button is pressed.

events.name: search
events.description: This event is fired when the Go button is pressed.

firedFromFilterBar.name: firedFromFilterBar
firedFromFilterBar.description: Set to true when event is fired due to user action in FilterBar

events.name: beforeVariantSave
events.description: This event is fired before a variant is saved. The event can be used to adapt the data of the custom filters, which will be saved as variant later. Note: This event is not fired during key user adaptation of the FilterBar right away. The variant is saved when the key user saves the draft. Therefore it's recommended to use the beforeVariantFetch event to adapt the data of custom filters for key user scenarios.

context.name: context
context.description: Context of the event. Can also be null or undefined

events.name: beforeVariantFetch
events.description: This event is fired before a variant is fetched.

events.name: afterVariantLoad
events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been loaded and applied to the FilterBar. The event can be used to adapt custom filters with data from the variant.

deleted.name: deleted
deleted.description: This property is provided, whenever a filter is removed via the add/remove filters dialog.

filterItem.name: filterItem
filterItem.description: The filter item is only provided along with added or deleted properties.

events.name: clear
events.description: This event is fired when the Clear button is pressed. The consumer has to clear all filters.

events.name: initialise
events.description: This event is fired when the FilterBar is initialized to indicate that metadata are available.

events.name: initialized
events.description: This event is fired after the FilterBar has been initialized, the user's default variant has been applied, and a stable filter state has been achieved. With this event all relevant filter information, for example, for navigation-related actions, is available via {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar#getUiState}.

events.name: afterVariantSave
events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been saved.

events.description: This event is fired when the filters information has changed. It indicates specifically that the count of assigned filters may be changed. One of the intended reaction to this event would be to call retrieveFiltersWithValuesAsText method.

}

methods.name: getAdvancedMode

returnValue.description: Value of property advancedMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAdvancedMode advancedMode}. The advanced mode is only relevant for the value help scenario. UI representation is different from the standard FilterBar. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: filters Of the current variant

parameters.name: bConsiderOnlyVisibleFields
parameters.description: Indicates that only visible filters are retrieved. Note: hidden filters are treated as visible filters.

methods.description: Retrieves filters belonging to the current variant.

methods.name: getBasicSearch
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getBasicSearch basicSearch}, or null.

methods.name: getBasicSearchName

returnValue.description: name of the basic search field.

methods.description: Determine the internal basic search field name.

methods.name: getBasicSearchValue

returnValue.description: current value of the basic search field.

methods.description: Determine the value of the basic search.

methods.name: getConsiderGroupTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property considerGroupTitle

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getConsiderGroupTitle considerGroupTitle}. If this property is set, then the label for filters will be prefixed with the group title. Default value is false.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}. Do NOT use this aggregation directly. The FilterBar control is not meant to be used with arbitrary content. It renders filterFields which are added by filterGroupItems aggregation. If you need to add some content below the FilterBar, this can be done by adding it as sibling of the FilterBar. For example, if FilterBar is child of DynamicPageHeader, the custom content can be added to the DynamicPageHeader as well.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: ID of the current variant

methods.description: Retrieves the current variant ID.

methods.name: getDataSuiteFormat

returnValue.description: JSON string representing the selection variant for UI navigation; null otherwise

parameters.name: bConsiderAllFilters
parameters.description: also include empty/invisible fields filter data

methods.description: Retrieves the current variant as selection variant for UI navigation

methods.name: getDeltaVariantMode

returnValue.description: Value of property deltaVariantMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDeltaVariantMode deltaVariantMode}. Stores the delta as compared to the standard variant. Default value is true.

methods.name: getDescriptionForKeys

parameters.name: aFiltersWithValuesToBeRead
parameters.description: List of filters with value keys to be retrieved

methods.description: Reads the descriptions for given filters and value keys.

methods.name: getDisableSearchMatchesPatternWarning

returnValue.description: Value of property disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisableSearchMatchesPatternWarning disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning}. Disables the warning for special symbols. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFilterBarExpanded

returnValue.description: Value of property filterBarExpanded

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterBarExpanded filterBarExpanded}. Shows the filters area. When property useToolbar is set to false, filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note: When SmartFilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog, it is initially collapsed. The filter bar is initially expanded in the following cases: - When there is no basic search field. - When preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog is set to true or the fetchValues property of the valueList annotation is set to 2. - When there are mandatory fields, all fields are expanded (not only the first 7). Default value is true.

methods.name: getFilterContainerWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property filterContainerWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterContainerWidth filterContainerWidth}. Sets the width of the filters container. Default value is "12rem".

methods.name: getFilterDialogContent

returnValue.description: of filters dialog content.

methods.description: Returns the filter dialog content. Node:The original content is a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form}. The form may be enhanced with a toolbar to enable the inner switch to an added custom content. Besides such operations, the original content should not be manipulated in any way.

methods.name: getFilterGroupItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getFilterGroupItems filterGroupItems}. Contains all FilterBar filters.
Note:In case a filter has to be added to the basic group
  • the property groupName has to be set to the constant sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.INTERNAL_GROUP
  • the property groupLabel will be handled internally and will be ignored, if set
  • the property partOfCurrentVariant has to be set to true
  • if the property visibleInFilterBar is set to true, the property partOfCurrentVariant will be set internally also to true

methods.name: getFilterItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getFilterItems filterItems}.

methods.name: getUseSnapshot

returnValue.description: Value of property useSnapshot

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseSnapshot useSnapshot}. Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

methods.name: getUseToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseToolbar useToolbar}. Determines what design is used. Default is the design with toolbar. If the property useToolbar is set to false, the property filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note:
If set to false, the VariantManagement control is not available at all. This scenario is only intended for the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar}. Default value is true.

Example:

parameters.name: mProperties

strictMode.name: strictMode
strictMode.description:
Determines filters and parameters based on the name.
  • true: Determines filters and parameters based on their exact name and type. If there is no exact match, the filter/parameter will be ignored.
  • false: Determines parameters first following this rule set:
    • If a parameter is found, use it.
    • If a filter is found, check first if a matching parameter exists with the filter name prefixed with "P_". If there is a match, use it as parameter, otherwise use it as filter.

parameters.description: controls the API behavior

Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

If set to false, the VariantManagement control is not available at all. This scenario is only intended for the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.ChangeHandlerType
symbols.description:
Type of change handler type for link personalization.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'navpopover.ChangeHandlerType'.

properties.name: addLink
properties.description: Change handler creating a change for an added link.

properties.name: moveLink
properties.description: Change handler creating a change for a moved link.

properties.name: removeLink
properties.description: Change handler creating a change for a removed link.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
symbols.description:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink} and {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController SemanticObjectController} to define the visible links on {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover}.

properties.name: target
properties.description: The standard values for the target property are: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. This property is only used if the href property is set.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Describes whether the link should be visible on the screen.

properties.name: isSuperiorAction
properties.description: Marker for superior action.

properties.name: visibleChangedByUser
properties.description: Describes whether the visibility is changed by end user or not.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover
symbols.description: The NavigationPopover control is used to present information in a specific format. Note: This control is used by the {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler NavigationPopoverHandler} and must not be used manually.

deprecated.text: SmartLink no longer opens a NavigationPopover, it got replaced by the sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel in a sap.m.ResponsivePopover

properties.name: semanticObjectName
properties.description: The name of the semantic object.

deprecated.text: The property semanticObjectName is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

properties.name: semanticAttributes
properties.description: Describes the semantic attributes. The attribute has to be a map.

deprecated.text: The property semanticAttributes is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

properties.name: appStateKey
properties.description: The application state key passed to retrieve the navigation targets.

properties.name: mainNavigationId
properties.description: Sets the description of the main navigation link. If mainNavigation also contains an href description, then mainNavigationId is displayed. If mainNavigationId is set to an empty string '', neither description nor subtitle are displayed.

properties.name: availableActionsPersonalizationText
properties.description: Determines the text of personalization link. If this property is set to some string, choosing the personalization link will trigger the availableActionsPersonalizationPress event. If this property is not set, the personalization link is not shown.

aggregations.name: availableActions
aggregations.description: A list of available actions shown as links.

aggregations.name: mainNavigation
aggregations.description: The main navigation link. If mainNavigationId is not set then text of mainNavigation is displayed. Otherwise the mainNavigationId is displayed.

aggregations.name: ownNavigation
aggregations.description: The navigation taking the user back to the source application.

deprecated.text: The property ownNavigation is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

associations.description: Source control for which the popover is displayed.

associations.description: In addition to main navigation link and available links some additional content can be displayed in the popover.

associations.description: The parent component.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler
symbols.description:
The NavigationPopoverHandler control determines navigation targets for a semantic object and shows them together with further information in a Popover.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} of the unified shell service.

deprecated.text: SmartLink no longer uses the NavigationPopoverHandler, it got replaced by a sap.ui.mdc.Link implementation. All event handlings can be done directly on the SmartLink / SemanticObjectController.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: Name of semantic object which is used to determine target navigations.

properties.name: additionalSemanticObjects
properties.description: Names of additional semantic objects which are used to determine target navigations.

properties.name: semanticObjectController
properties.description: The semantic object controller controls events for several NavigationPopoverHandler controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

properties.name: fieldName
properties.description: The metadata field name for this NavigationPopoverHandler control.

properties.name: semanticObjectLabel
properties.description: Shown title of semantic object.

deprecated.text: Title section with semanticObjectLabel has been removed due to new UI design

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description: If set to false, the NavigationPopoverHandler control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several NavigationPopoverHandler on the same semantic object. *

properties.name: contactAnnotationPath
properties.description: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description: Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a Promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description: Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

aggregations.name: _popover
aggregations.description: Stores the inner popover to influence design-time

associations.name: control
associations.description: The parent control.

events.name: beforePopoverOpens
events.description: Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of NavigationPopoverHandler, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets will be retrieved.

semanticAttributes.name: semanticAttributes
semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes calculated from the binding that will be used to retrieve the navigation targets.

deprecated.text: The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.name: semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects
semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.description: A map of semantic objects for which the navigation targets will be retrieved and it's semantic attributes calculated from the binding context. The semantic attributes will be used as parameters in order to retrieve the navigation targets.

originalId.description: The ID of the NavigationPopoverHandler.

open.name: open
open.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If the beforePopoverOpens has been registered, the open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover.

events.name: navigationTargetsObtained
events.description: After the navigation targets are retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and provides the possibility to change the targets.

semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

originalId.name: originalId

show.name: show
show.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()
  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getContactAnnotationPath contactAnnotationPath}. Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one. Default value is undefined.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization}. Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. Default value is true.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFieldName fieldName}.

The metadata field name for this NavigationPopoverHandler control.

methods.name: getMapFieldToSemanticObject

returnValue.description: Value of property mapFieldToSemanticObject

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject}. If set to false, the NavigationPopoverHandler control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several NavigationPopoverHandler on the same semantic object. * Default value is true.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler.

methods.name: getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback navigationTargetsObtainedCallback}. Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSemanticObject semanticObject}.

Name of semantic object which is used to determine target navigations.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectController

returnValue.description: Value of property semanticObjectController

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController}.

The semantic object controller controls events for several NavigationPopoverHandler controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectLabel

returnValue.description: Value of property semanticObjectLabel

methods.description:

methods.name: setBeforeNavigationCallback

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnBeforeNavigationCallback
parameters.description: New value for property beforeNavigationCallback

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getBeforeNavigationCallback beforeNavigationCallback}. Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a Promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is undefined.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets
symbols.description: Object holding the information regarding the obtained navigation targets and extra content. This is used as parameter and return value of the Promise in the navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.

properties.name: mainNavigationId
properties.description: The text of the main link / text that is displayed in the header of the popover.

properties.name: mainNavigation
properties.description: The main navigation object

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Array of available navigation target objects

properties.name: ownNavigation
properties.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is not visible on the popover by default.

properties.name: popoverForms
properties.description: Array containing contact data. Manipulating this property won't have an effect, it's only relevant to be streamlined with the old API. The extraContent property is used to return the intended content.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved

properties.name: semanticAttributes
properties.description: Map containing the semantic attributes

properties.name: originalId
properties.description: The ID of the SmartLink or other parent control

properties.name: extraContent
properties.description: The control that is displayed in the extra content section on the popover. If set to null, the extra content is removed. If set to undefined, a {@link sap.m.VBox} containing the popoverForms as items is used as extra content. The popoverForms can be empty.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
symbols.description: The SemanticObjectController control operates as a single entry point for SmartLink controls created automatically by {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable SmartTable} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart SmartChart} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm SmartForm} control and {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField SmartField} control based on OData metadata. Additionally, all events provided by the SmartLink control are registered by the SemanticObjectController and can be consumed there in a single place. As usual, the SemanticObjectController can be defined within the XML view as well as in the code.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description: Comma-separated list of fields that must not be displayed as links.

properties.name: prefetchNavigationTargets
properties.description: If set to true, the SemanticObjectController will retrieve all navigation targets once and will disable links for which no targets were found. Setting this value to true will trigger an additional roundtrip.

deprecated.text: The property prefetchNavigationTargets is obsolete as navigation targets are determined automatically. The SmartLink controls are re-rendered as soon as the asynchronous determination of navigation targets has been completed.

properties.name: fieldSemanticObjectMap
properties.description: Maps the fields to the related semantic objects. When accessing this property for the first time, the mapping will be calculated from the metadata within the provided model.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The name of the entity set used. If entitySet has not been defined, the SemanticObjectController tries to retrieve the name from its parents. Note: This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

properties.name: contactAnnotationPaths
properties.description: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, '\{"Supplier":"to_Supplier", "CompanyName":"to_Company"\}' . An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description: Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. For example, '\{"Supplier":false, "CompanyName":true\}' .

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description: If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes.

properties.name: forceLinkRendering
properties.description: Object containing fields for which the corresponding SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPaths is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.\n Note: The ignoredFields property and the ignoreLinkRendering property of the SmartLink control take precedence over forceLinkRendering.\n Example of usage: '\{"Supplier":"true", "CompanyName":"true"\}'

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

properties.name: replaceSmartLinkNavigationTargetsObtained
properties.description: Determines if the navigationTargetsObtained event handling of the SmartLink should be replaced when this SemanticObjectController is set as SemanticObjectController on the SmartLink.

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description: Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the SmartLinkFieldInfo. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

events.name: navigationTargetsObtained
events.description: After the navigation targets have been retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and makes it possible you to change the targets.

actions.name: actions
actions.description: Array of available navigation target objects.

ownNavigation.name: ownNavigation
ownNavigation.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved.

semanticAttributes.name: semanticAttributes
semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

originalId.name: originalId
originalId.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If navigationTargetsObtained is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is also the SmartLink's ID. If navigationTargetsObtained is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

show.name: show
show.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()
  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

events.name: beforePopoverOpens
events.description: Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink, beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets will be retrieved.

semanticAttributes.name: semanticAttributes
semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes calculated from the binding that will be used to retrieve the navigation targets.

deprecated.text: The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.name: semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects
semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.description: A map of semantic objects for which the navigation targets will be retrieved and it's semantic attributes calculated from the binding context. The semantic attributes will be used as parameters in order to retrieve the navigation targets.

setSemanticAttributes.name: setSemanticAttributes
setSemanticAttributes.description:
This callback function enables you to define a changed semantic attributes map. Signatures: setSemanticAttributes(oSemanticAttributesMap) Parameter:
  • {object} oSemanticAttributesMap New map containing the semantic attributes
  • {string} sSemanticObject Semantic Object for which the oSemanticAttributesMap belongs

setAppStateKey.name: setAppStateKey
setAppStateKey.description:
This callback function sets an application state key that is used over the cross-application navigation. Signatures: setAppStateKey(sAppStateKey) Parameter:
  • {string} sAppStateKey

originalId.name: originalId
originalId.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is also the SmartLink's ID. If the beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

open.name: open
open.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If beforePopoverOpens has been registered, open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover or trigger a direct navigation.

events.name: navigate
events.description: This event is fired after a navigation link on the navigation popover has been clicked. This event is only fired, if the user left-clicks the link. Right-clicking the link and selecting 'Open in New Window' etc. in the context menu does not fire the event.

text.name: text
text.description: The UI text shown in the clicked link.

href.name: href
href.description: The navigation target of the clicked link.

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: The semantic object used to retrieve this target.

semanticAttributes.name: semanticAttributes
semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes used to retrieve this target.

originalId.name: originalId
originalId.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If navigate is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is the SmartLink's ID. If navigate is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

events.name: prefetchDone
events.description: If the property prefetchNavigationTargets is set to true, event prefetchDone is fired after all navigation targets have been retrieved.

deprecated.text: The event prefetchDone is obsolete because it depends on the property prefetchNavigationTargets which has been deprecated.

semanticObjects.name: semanticObjects
semanticObjects.description: A map containing all semantic objects as keys for which at least one navigation target has been found. The value for each semantic object key is an array containing the available actions found for this semantic object.

parameters.name: sID
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: attachBeforePopoverOpens

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} event of this sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController itself. Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink, beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

show.name: show
show.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()
  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

methods.name: getBeforeNavigationCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property beforeNavigationCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getBeforeNavigationCallback beforeNavigationCallback}. Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

methods.name: getContactAnnotationPaths

returnValue.description: Value of property contactAnnotationPaths

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getContactAnnotationPaths contactAnnotationPaths}. Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, '\{"Supplier":"to_Supplier", "CompanyName":"to_Company"\}' . An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

methods.name: getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAvailableActionsPersonalization

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization}. Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. For example, '\{"Supplier":false, "CompanyName":true\}' .

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEntitySet entitySet}. The name of the entity set used. If entitySet has not been defined, the SemanticObjectController tries to retrieve the name from its parents. Note: This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

methods.name: getFieldSemanticObjectMap

returnValue.description: Value of property fieldSemanticObjectMap

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFieldSemanticObjectMap fieldSemanticObjectMap}.

Maps the fields to the related semantic objects. When accessing this property for the first time, the mapping will be calculated from the metadata within the provided model.

methods.name: getForceLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property forceLinkRendering

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getForceLinkRendering forceLinkRendering}. Object containing fields for which the corresponding SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPaths is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.\n Note: The ignoredFields property and the ignoreLinkRendering property of the SmartLink control take precedence over forceLinkRendering.\n Example of usage: '\{"Supplier":"true", "CompanyName":"true"\}'

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields}.

Comma-separated list of fields that must not be displayed as links.

returnValue.description: Value of property mapFieldToSemanticObject

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject}. If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes.

methods.name: getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback navigationTargetsObtainedCallback}. Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the SmartLinkFieldInfo. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

If set to true, the SemanticObjectController will retrieve all navigation targets once and will disable links for which no targets were found. Setting this value to true will trigger an additional roundtrip. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink
symbols.description:
The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover} for further navigation steps.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} of the unified shell service. Important: Keep in mind that SmartLink, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application. With time, SmartLink can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartLink only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: Name of semantic object which is used to fill the navigation popover. Note: Setting a value triggers an asynchronous determination, so the effect can be delayed.

properties.name: additionalSemanticObjects
properties.description: Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links.

properties.name: semanticObjectController
properties.description: The semantic object controller controls events for several SmartLink controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

properties.name: fieldName
properties.description: The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.

properties.name: semanticObjectLabel
properties.description: Shown label of semantic object.

deprecated.text: Title section with semanticObjectLabel has been removed due to new UI design

properties.name: createControlCallback
properties.description: Function that enables the SmartLink control to create an alternative control, which is displayed if ignoreLinkRendering is enabled. The function has no parameters and has to return an instance of sap.ui.core.Control.

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description: If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object.

properties.name: contactAnnotationPath
properties.description: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

properties.name: ignoreLinkRendering
properties.description: If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description: Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.

properties.name: forceLinkRendering
properties.description: If set to true, the SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPath is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called. Note: The ignoreLinkRendering property and the ignoredFields property of the associated SemanticObjectController take precedence over forceLinkRendering.

properties.name: uom
properties.description: Additionally to the text property the Unit of Measure can be displayed.

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is no sufficient space.

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description: Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

aggregations.name: innerControl
aggregations.description: Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.

events.name: beforePopoverOpens
events.description: Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink control, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

semanticObject.name: semanticObject
semanticObject.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets will be retrieved.

semanticAttributes.name: semanticAttributes
semanticAttributes.description: Map containing the semantic attributes calculated from the binding that will be used to retrieve the navigation targets.

deprecated.text: The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.name: semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects
semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.description: A map of semantic objects for which the navigation targets will be retrieved and it's semantic attributes calculated from the binding context. The semantic attributes will be used as parameters in order to retrieve the navigation targets.

setSemanticAttributes.name: setSemanticAttributes
setSemanticAttributes.description:
This callback function enables you to define a changed semantic attributes map. Signatures: setSemanticAttributes(oSemanticAttributesMap) Parameter:
  • {object} oSemanticAttributesMap New map containing the semantic attributes
  • {string} sSemanticObject Semantic Object for which the oSemanticAttributesMap belongs

show.name: show
show.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()
  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

methods.name: getAdditionalSemanticObjects

returnValue.description: Value of property additionalSemanticObjects

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAdditionalSemanticObjects additionalSemanticObjects}. Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links. Default value is [].

methods.name: getBeforeNavigationCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property beforeNavigationCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getBeforeNavigationCallback beforeNavigationCallback}. Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

methods.name: getContactAnnotationPath

returnValue.description: Value of property contactAnnotationPath

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getContactAnnotationPath contactAnnotationPath}. Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one. Default value is undefined.

methods.name: getCreateControlCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property createControlCallback

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCreateControlCallback createControlCallback}. Function that enables the SmartLink control to create an alternative control, which is displayed if ignoreLinkRendering is enabled. The function has no parameters and has to return an instance of sap.ui.core.Control.

methods.name: getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAvailableActionsPersonalization

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization}. Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user. Default value is true.

returnValue.description: extra content
Inner FieldInfo

methods.name: getFieldName

returnValue.description: Value of property fieldName

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFieldName fieldName}.

The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.

methods.name: getForceLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property forceLinkRendering

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getForceLinkRendering forceLinkRendering}. If set to true, the SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPath is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called. Note: The ignoreLinkRendering property and the ignoredFields property of the associated SemanticObjectController take precedence over forceLinkRendering. Default value is false.

methods.name: getIgnoreLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreLinkRendering

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoreLinkRendering ignoreLinkRendering}. If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch. Default value is false.

methods.name: getInnerControl
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getInnerControl innerControl}. Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.

methods.name: getInnerControlValue

returnValue.description: The value of innerControl aggregate or the text of the SmartLink

methods.description: Gets the value of the innerControl aggregate if available, otherwise the text of SmartLink control will be returned.

returnValue.description: the mainNavigationLink
mainNavigationId

methods.name: getMapFieldToSemanticObject

returnValue.description: Value of property mapFieldToSemanticObject

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject}. If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object. Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Gets the composition NavigationPopoverHandler

deprecated.text: The SmartLink does not use the NavigationPopoverHandler anymore due to deprecation.

methods.name: getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback navigationTargetsObtainedCallback}. Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

methods.name: setForceLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bForceLinkRendering
parameters.description: New value for property forceLinkRendering

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getForceLinkRendering forceLinkRendering}. If set to true, the SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPath is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called. Note: The ignoreLinkRendering property and the ignoredFields property of the associated SemanticObjectController take precedence over forceLinkRendering. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setIgnoreLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bIgnoreLinkRendering
parameters.description: New value for property ignoreLinkRendering

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIgnoreLinkRendering ignoreLinkRendering}. If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bMapFieldToSemanticObject
parameters.description: New value for property mapFieldToSemanticObject

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject}. If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback
parameters.description: New value for property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback navigationTargetsObtainedCallback}. Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

properties.name: columnKey
properties.description: Can be used as input for subsequent actions.

properties.description: The text to be displayed for the item.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Defines visibility of column

properties.name: type
properties.description: data type of the column (text, numeric or date is supported)

properties.name: typeInstance
properties.description: data type instance of the column. Can be used instead of the type, precision, scale and formatSettings properties

properties.name: precision
properties.description: if type==numeric the precision will be used to format the entered value (maxIntegerDigits of the used Formatter)

properties.name: formatSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the formatSettings which will be used to pass additional type/format settings for the entered value. if type==time or date or datetime the object will be used for the DateFormatter, TimeFormatter or DateTimeFormatter Below you can find a brief example 

{
		UTC: false,
		style: "medium" //"short" or "long"
}

properties.name: scale
properties.description: if type==numeric the scale will be used to format the entered value (maxFractionDigits of the used Formatter)

properties.description: specifies the number of characters which can be entered in the value fields of the condition panel
