symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.personalization.AggregationRole
symbols.description:
Provides enumeration sap.ui.comp.personalization.AggregationRole. A subset of aggregation roles used in table personalization.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'personalization.AggregationRole'.

properties.name: Dimension
properties.description: Dimension role.

properties.name: Measure
properties.description: Measure role.

properties.name: NotDimeasure
properties.description: Role which is neither dimension nor measure.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.personalization.ChangeType
symbols.description:
Provides enumeration sap.ui.comp.personalization.ChangeType. A subset of changes done during table personalization.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'personalization.ChangeType'.

properties.name: ModelChanged
properties.description: Change is applied to model but not applied to table

properties.name: TableChanged
properties.description: Change is applied to model and to table

properties.name: Unchanged
properties.description: Not changed

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.personalization.ColumnType

Provides enumeration sap.ui.comp.personalization.ColumnType. A subset of column types that fit for table personalization.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'personalization.ColumnType'.

properties.description: Represents sap.m.Column.

properties.name: TableColumn
properties.description: Represents sap.ui.table.Column.

symbols.description:
Provides enumeration sap.ui.comp.personalization.ResetType. A subset of reset types used in table personalization.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'personalization.ResetType'.

properties.name: ResetFull
properties.description: Reset back to Restore (i.e. the version of the table with which the controller was instantiated or via setter updated) was triggered (either via API or via reset button)

properties.name: ResetPartial

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode
symbols.description:
Enumeration for supported selection mode in SmartChart

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartchart.SelectionMode'.

properties.name: Multi
properties.description: Multi selection mode, multiple sets of data points can be selected at once.

properties.name: None
properties.description: None selection mode, no data points can be selected.

properties.name: Single
properties.description: Single selection mode, only one set of data points can be selected at once.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart
symbols.description:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on the OData metadata and the provided configuration. To use the control, the entitySet property must be specified. This property is used to fetch the metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render initially the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Important: Keep in mind that SmartChart, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application. With time, SmartChart can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartChart only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

properties.name: smartFilterId
properties.description: ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control. If specified, the SmartChart control searches for the SmartFilter control (also in the closest parent view) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter control to fetch data, show overlay etc.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartChart control.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: requestAtLeastFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

properties.name: ignoreFromPersonalisation
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

properties.name: ignoredChartTypes
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: useVariantManagement
properties.description: If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

properties.name: useChartPersonalisation
properties.description: If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}.

properties.name: headerStyle
properties.description:
Defines style of the header.
For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitle}.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

properties.name: currentVariantId
properties.description: Retrieves or applies the current variant.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

properties.name: chartBindingPath
properties.description: Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

properties.name: showDrillButtons
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons.

properties.name: showZoomButtons
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.

properties.name: showSemanticNavigationButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

properties.name: showVariantManagement
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Variant Management.

properties.name: showDownloadButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the chart download button.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Details button. If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible.

properties.name: showDrillBreadcrumbs
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point.

properties.name: showLegendButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description: Set chart's legend properties.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description: Chart selection mode. Supported values are {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Single} or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Multi}, case insensitive, always return in upper case. Unsupported values will be ignored.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

properties.name: useTooltip
properties.description: Specifies weather an instance of {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip} or {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover} is used. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed, a popover otherwise.

properties.name: useListForChartTypeSelection
properties.description: Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

deprecated.text: Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

properties.name: showChartTypeSelectionButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the chart type selection button.

properties.name: noData
properties.description: Defines the custom text that will be displayed in case no data is found for the current binding.

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the toolbar.

properties.name: toolbarStyle
properties.description: Defines the visual style of the smart charts Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

properties.name: showDimensionsTitle
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the title in the dimension area of the chart.

properties.name: showMeasuresTitle
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the title in the measure area of the chart.

properties.name: activateTimeSeries
properties.description: Enables the use of timeseries on the inner chart when corresponding annotation is given Note: This timeseries is only supported for the following {@link sap.chart.TimeUnitType TimeUnitTypes} and the following chart types {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame#getVizType}.

properties.name: notAssignedText
properties.description: Text that is shown for values of an empty string. Note: The property does not change the behavior for charts of type timeseries. Note: Can only be changed in the XML/JS view. It cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsItemActions
aggregations.description: Actions on item level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActions
aggregations.description: Actions on footer level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActionGroups
aggregations.description: Actions on group level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

events.name: initialise
events.description: This event is fired once the control has been initialized. Note: For compatibility reasons the sap.chart library is loaded synchroniously as soon as a event handler for the initialise event has been attached. Since this event does not fulfill CSP requirements, please use event initialized instead.

events.name: initialized
events.description: This event is fired once the control has been initialized, asynchronous successor of initialise.

events.name: beforeRebindChart
events.description:
This event is fired right before the SmartChart control triggers the binding / rebinding of the inner chart.
Note: In certain cases the inner chart triggers a rebinding by itself. In these cases, the event is not fired.

bindingParams.name: bindingParams
bindingParams.description: The bindingParams object contains filters, sorters, and other binding-related information for the chart

bindingParams.preventChartBind.name: bindingParams.preventChartBind
bindingParams.preventChartBind.description: If set to true by the listener, binding is prevented

bindingParams.filters.name: bindingParams.filters
bindingParams.filters.description: The combined filter array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Filter instances of the SmartChart and SmartFilter controls; can be modified by users to influence filtering

bindingParams.sorter.name: bindingParams.sorter
bindingParams.sorter.description: An array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Sorter instances of the SmartChart control (personalization); can be modified by users to influence sorting

bindingParams.length.name: bindingParams.length
bindingParams.length.description: The maximal number of items that is displayed for the SmartChart control

bindingParams.parameters.name: bindingParams.parameters
bindingParams.parameters.description: a map of parameters which is passed to the binding

bindingParams.events.name: bindingParams.events
bindingParams.events.description: map of event listeners for the binding events (since 1.56). The events listeners can only be registered while the binding is created. So, ensure that the events parameter is filled from the beginning, so that the registration can be done while the binding is created.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description: This event is fired when data is received after binding. This event is fired if the binding for the chart is done by the SmartChart control itself.

deprecated.text: Use beforeRebindChart event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.name: afterVariantInitialise
events.description: This event is fired after the variant management in the SmartChart control has been initialized.

events.name: afterVariantSave
events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been saved. This event can be used to retrieve the ID of the saved variant.

currentVariantId.name: currentVariantId
currentVariantId.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.name: afterVariantApply
events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been applied.

currentVariantId.name: currentVariantId
currentVariantId.description: ID of the currently selected variant

variantContext.name: variantContext
variantContext.description: Context in which the variant has been applied

events.name: showOverlay
events.description: This event is fired right before the overlay is shown.

events.name: fullScreenToggled
events.description: This event is fired right after the full screen mode of the SmartChart control has been changed.

fullScreen.name: fullScreen
fullScreen.description: If true the control is in full screen mode

events.name: selectionDetailsActionPress
events.description: This event is fired when any action in the selection details popover is pressed.

action.name: action
action.description: The action that has to be processed once the action has been pressed

itemContexts.name: itemContexts
itemContexts.description: If the action is pressed on one of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}, the parameter contains the {@link sap.ui.model.Context context} of the pressed {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem item}. If a custom action or action group of the SelectionDetails popover is pressed, this parameter contains all {@link sap.ui.model.Context contexts} of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}.

level.name: level
level.description: The action level of action buttons. The available levels are Item, List and Group

events.name: chartDataChanged
events.description:
This event is fired when SmartChart control data changes, due to changes in the personalization dialog or drill operations.
The data can be changed via sorters, filters or drill-ups/drill-downs.

changeTypes.name: changeTypes
changeTypes.description: Object which contains a boolean flag for dimeasure, filter, sort. If set to true, it has been changed.

events.name: uiStateChange
events.description: This event is fired when the UI state changes either via the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart#setUiState} method or the chart personalization.

annotations.name: semanticObject
fieldVisible
presentationVariant
chart
dataPoint
text
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. If no text arrangement has been defined, the default display behavior is TextFirst. An example how this is set in OData v4 is shown here: 
   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="ProductName">
In OData v2 it looks like this: 
    <Property name="ProductId" ... sap:text="ProductName"/>

annotations.name: textArrangement
IsFiscalYear
IsFiscalYearPeriod
IsFiscalPeriod
IsFiscalQuarter
IsFiscalYearQuarter
IsFiscalWeek
IsFiscalYearWeek
IsCalendarYear
IsCalendarQuarter
IsCalendarMonth
IsCalendarWeek
IsCalendarYearQuarter
IsCalendarYearMonth
IsCalendarYearWeek
IsCalendarDate
timezone

methods.name: getActivateTimeSeries

returnValue.description: Value of property activateTimeSeries

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getActivateTimeSeries activateTimeSeries}. Enables the use of timeseries on the inner chart when corresponding annotation is given Note: This timeseries is only supported for the following {@link sap.chart.TimeUnitType TimeUnitTypes} and the following chart types {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame#getVizType}. Default value is false.

methods.name: getChart

returnValue.description: The inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns the chart object used internally.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner {@link sap.chart.Chart chart} object or its {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame vizFrame} might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn"t listen to all changes made to the inner {@link sap.chart.Chart chart} instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself. Note: Calling this method when the chart is not yet initialized causes the inner chart to load synchronously. This does not fulfill CSP requirements. Please use getChartAsync instead.

methods.name: getChartAsync

returnValue.description: Promise for inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns a promise which will be resolved with the internally used chart object, once all dependencies have been loaded.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner {@link sap.chart.Chart chart} object or its {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame vizFrame} might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn't listen to all changes made to the inner {@link sap.chart.Chart chart} instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself.

methods.name: getChartBindingPath

returnValue.description: Value of property chartBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath}.

Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

methods.name: getChartType

returnValue.description: Value of property chartType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getChartType chartType}.

Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: ID of the currently selected variant

methods.description: Returns the ID of the currently selected variant.

methods.name: getEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoBinding

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding}. If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEntitySet entitySet}. The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeader header}.

Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

methods.name: getHeaderLevel

returnValue.description: Value of property headerLevel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderLevel headerLevel}. Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}. Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getHeaderStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property headerStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderStyle headerStyle}. Defines style of the header.
For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitle}. Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getIgnoredChartTypes

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredChartTypes

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoredChartTypes ignoredChartTypes}. CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields}. CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartChart control.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation}. CSV of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getLegendVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property legendVisible

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible}. Set chart's legend properties. Default value is true.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.

methods.name: getNoData

returnValue.description: Value of property noData

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getNoData noData}.

Defines the custom text that will be displayed in case no data is found for the current binding.

methods.name: getNotAssignedText

returnValue.description: Value of property notAssignedText

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNotAssignedText notAssignedText}. Text that is shown for values of an empty string. Note: The property does not change the behavior for charts of type timeseries. Note: Can only be changed in the XML/JS view. It cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getPersistencyKey

returnValue.description: Value of property persistencyKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey}.

Key used to access personalization data.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields}. CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsActionGroups
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSelectionDetailsActionGroups selectionDetailsActionGroups}.

Actions on group level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsActions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSelectionDetailsActions selectionDetailsActions}.

Actions on footer level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsItemActions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSelectionDetailsItemActions selectionDetailsItemActions}.

Actions on item level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode}. Chart selection mode. Supported values are {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Single} or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Multi}, case insensitive, always return in upper case. Unsupported values will be ignored. Default value is Multi.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectController
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController}.

The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

methods.name: getShowChartTooltip

returnValue.description: Value of property showChartTooltip

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowChartTooltip showChartTooltip}. Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowChartTypeSelectionButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showChartTypeSelectionButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowChartTypeSelectionButton showChartTypeSelectionButton}. Controls the visibility of the chart type selection button. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowDetailsButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDetailsButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDetailsButton showDetailsButton}. Controls the visibility of the Details button. If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDimensionsTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property showDimensionsTitle

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDimensionsTitle showDimensionsTitle}. Controls the visibility of the title in the dimension area of the chart. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowDownloadButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDownloadButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDownloadButton showDownloadButton}. Controls the visibility of the chart download button. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDrillBreadcrumbs

returnValue.description: Value of property showDrillBreadcrumbs

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDrillBreadcrumbs showDrillBreadcrumbs}. Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDrillButtons

returnValue.description: Value of property showDrillButtons

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDrillButtons showDrillButtons}. Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowFullScreenButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showFullScreenButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton}. Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowLegendButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showLegendButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowLegendButton showLegendButton}. Controls the visibility of the Navigation button Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowMeasuresTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property showMeasuresTitle

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowMeasuresTitle showMeasuresTitle}. Controls the visibility of the title in the measure area of the chart. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowSemanticNavigationButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showSemanticNavigationButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSemanticNavigationButton showSemanticNavigationButton}. Controls the visibility of the Navigation button Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property showToolbar

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar}. Controls the visibility of the toolbar. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property showVariantManagement

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement}. Controls the visibility of the Variant Management. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowZoomButtons

returnValue.description: Value of property showZoomButtons

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowZoomButtons showZoomButtons}. Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSmartFilterId

returnValue.description: Value of property smartFilterId

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId}.

ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control. If specified, the SmartChart control searches for the SmartFilter control (also in the closest parent view) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter control to fetch data, show overlay etc.

methods.name: getSmartVariant
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant}, or null.

methods.name: getToolbar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getToolbar toolbar}.

A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

methods.name: getToolbarStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property toolbarStyle

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getToolbarStyle toolbarStyle}. Defines the visual style of the smart charts Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

methods.name: getUiState

returnValue.description: Current UI state

methods.description: The method returns the current UI state of SmartChart control.

methods.name: getUseChartPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property useChartPersonalisation

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseChartPersonalisation useChartPersonalisation}. If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property. Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseListForChartTypeSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property useListForChartTypeSelection

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseListForChartTypeSelection useListForChartTypeSelection}. Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

methods.name: getUseTooltip

returnValue.description: Value of property useTooltip

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseTooltip useTooltip}. Specifies weather an instance of {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip} or {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover} is used. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed, a popover otherwise. Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property useVariantManagement

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement}. If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property. Default value is true.

methods.name: setActivateTimeSeries

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bActivateTimeSeries
parameters.description: New value for property activateTimeSeries

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getActivateTimeSeries activateTimeSeries}. Enables the use of timeseries on the inner chart when corresponding annotation is given Note: This timeseries is only supported for the following {@link sap.chart.TimeUnitType TimeUnitTypes} and the following chart types {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame#getVizType}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath}. Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setChartType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sChartType
parameters.description: New value for property chartType

methods.name: setCurrentVariantId

parameters.name: sVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

methods.description: Applies the current variant based on the sVariantId parameter. If an empty string or null or undefined have been passed, the standard variant will be used. The standard variant will also be used if the passed sVariantId cannot be found. If the flexibility variant, the content for the standard variant, or the personalizable control cannot be obtained, no changes will be made.

methods.name: setEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableAutoBinding
parameters.description: New value for property enableAutoBinding

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding}. If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.name: sNotAssignedText
parameters.description: New value for property notAssignedText

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNotAssignedText notAssignedText}. Text that is shown for values of an empty string. Note: The property does not change the behavior for charts of type timeseries. Note: Can only be changed in the XML/JS view. It cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setPersistencyKey

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sPersistencyKey
parameters.description: New value for property persistencyKey

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey}. Key used to access personalization data. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sRequestAtLeastFields
parameters.description: New value for property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields}. CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.name: bUseChartPersonalisation
parameters.description: New value for property useChartPersonalisation

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseChartPersonalisation useChartPersonalisation}. If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setUseListForChartTypeSelection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseListForChartTypeSelection
parameters.description: New value for property useListForChartTypeSelection

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseListForChartTypeSelection useListForChartTypeSelection}. Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration
symbols.description: The configuration allows to further define the behavior of a SmartField.

properties.name: controlType
properties.description: By default the SmartField chooses the controls it hosts by interpreting OData metadata. This property allows to overwrite the default behavior to some extent. For example makes it possible to define that an OData property of type Edm.Boolean is displayed as a combo box.

properties.name: displayBehaviour
properties.description: The property specifies how value help, that is available for input fields, is presented. For example, it specifies whether the descriptions of the values shown in the result after a query are displayed.

properties.name: criticalityQualifier
properties.description: The property specifies the qualifier of the DataPoint or FieldGroup annotation from which the criticality annotation information should be taken.

properties.name: preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog
properties.description: If there are value help annotations for a smart field, it is possible to specify whether the table in the value help dialog for this field will be filled initially. The default value is false, which means the table will be filled as the data fetch is not prevented. Note: As of version 1.78 the default value has been changed from true to false.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlContextType
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the different contexts supported by the SmartField, if it is using an OData model.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.ControlContextType'.

properties.name: Form
properties.description: Behaves currently exactly like sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlContextType.None.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No special context is selected. The Smart Field applies its internal defaults.

properties.name: ResponsiveTable
properties.description: Also the UoM layout is influenced.

properties.name: SmartFormGrid
properties.description: If this is selected the UoM layout is influenced.

properties.name: Table
properties.description: If this is selected the UoM layout is influenced.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getControlType controlType}. By default the SmartField chooses the controls it hosts by interpreting OData meta data. This property allows to overwrite the default behavior to some extent; for example this property allows to define that an OData property of type Edm.Boolean is displayed as combo box. Default value is None.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposal.

methods.name: getObjectStatus
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getObjectStatus objectStatus}.

Optional definition to further qualify how an object status control should be rendered.

methods.name: setControlType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sControlType
parameters.description: New value for property controlType

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getControlType controlType}. By default the SmartField chooses the controls it hosts by interpreting OData meta data. This property allows to overwrite the default behavior to some extent; for example this property allows to define that an OData property of type Edm.Boolean is displayed as combo box. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposalType
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the different control proposals supported by the Smart Field, if it is using an OData model.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.ControlProposalType'.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No special context is selected. The Smart Field applies its internal defaults.

properties.name: ObjectIdentifier
properties.description: If this is selected, the sap.m.ObjectIdentifier control is used to display IDs, if they are not editable. The current OData property is assumed to have a text annotation. Otherwise the configuration is ignored.

properties.name: ObjectNumber
properties.description: If this is selected, the sap.m.ObjectNumber control is used to display units of measure. If the value property of the Smart Field is not bound to a unit of measure, the property is ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlType
symbols.description:
The available control types to configure the internal control selection of a SmartField control.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.ControlType'.

properties.name: auto
properties.description: The SmartField control chooses the control to be displayed.

properties.name: checkBox
properties.description: The SmartField control displays a check box control.

properties.name: datePicker
properties.description: The SmartField control displays a date picker control.

properties.name: dropDownList
properties.description: The SmartField control displays a combo box control.

properties.name: input
properties.description: The SmartField control displays a text input field control.

properties.name: selection
properties.description: The SmartField control displays a select control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.CriticalityRepresentationType
symbols.description:
The different options to visualize the ObjectStatus control.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.CriticalityRepresentationType'.

properties.name: WithIcon
properties.description: If this is selected, the sap.m.ObjectStatus control visualizes the criticality using an icon.

properties.name: WithoutIcon
properties.description: If this is selected, the sap.m.ObjectStatus control does not visualize the criticality using an icon.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.DisplayBehaviour
symbols.description:
The different options to define display behavior for the value help of a SmartField control.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.DisplayBehaviour'.

properties.name: auto
properties.description: The SmartField chooses the display behavior.

properties.name: descriptionAndId
properties.description: Description and ID are displayed for available values.

properties.name: descriptionOnly
properties.description: Only the description of the available values is displayed.

properties.name: idAndDescription
properties.description: ID and description are displayed for available values.

properties.name: idOnly
properties.description: Shows the ID only.

properties.name: OnOff
properties.description: Shows Boolean value as On/Off

properties.name: TrueFalse
properties.description: Shows Boolean value as True/False

properties.name: YesNo
properties.description: Shows Boolean value as Yes/No

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Importance
symbols.description:
Provides information about the importance of the field

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.Importance'.

properties.name: High
properties.description: SmartField with high importance

properties.name: Low
properties.description: SmartField with low importance

properties.name: Medium
properties.description: SmartField with medium importance

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.JSONType
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the different data types supported by the SmartField control, if it is using a JSON model.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.JSONType'.

properties.name: Boolean
properties.description: Boolean Type

properties.name: Date
properties.description: The JavaScript Date Object

properties.name: DateTime
properties.description: Date Time Type

properties.name: Float
properties.description: Float type

properties.name: Integer
properties.description: Integer type

properties.name: String
properties.description: The JavaScript primary type String

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ObjectStatus
symbols.description: Defines a possible object status control to be rendered. The smart field may ignore the proposal.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField
symbols.description:
The SmartField control interprets metadata that represents entity-relationship models, data types, service capabilities, and annotations in OData services to automatically generate the underlying inner controls and reduce the amount of code needed for developing applications.

Binding and Context

Important: You must always use the standard two-way binding and provide binding context. In some cases, the OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the value property of the control.

Structure

The SmartField control contains a basic UI element and an optional label. In display mode the following UI elements are available to be rendered depending on the metadata:
  • {@link sap.m.Text Text}
  • {@link sap.m.Link Link}
  • {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink}
In edit mode, the available UI elements are:
  • One or two {@link sap.m.Input Input} fields (with or without a {@link sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDialog ValueHelpDialog})
  • {@link sap.m.Select Select}
  • {@link sap.m.ComboBox ComboBox}
  • {@link sap.m.TextArea TextArea}
  • {@link sap.m.Checkbox Checkbox}
  • {@link sap.m.DatePicker DatePicker}
  • {@link sap.m.DateTimePicker DateTimePicker}
  • {@link sap.m.TimePicker TimePicker}
The SmartField comes with additional built-in features, such as autocomplete and suggestions, value help dialog, recently used and recommended values, textInEditModeSource, validation, and message handling.

Usage

When to use
  • You use an OData service for your app (only OData version 2).
  • You use the smart table and your app is not performance critical. The SmartField control offers more flexibility than the controls provided directly by the smart table, especially for editing.
  • You use a smart form.
When not to use
  • You are not using OData version 2.
  • You need a different control for entering or displaying data, such as multi input, a multi combo box, step input, a radio button, or a title. In this case, use the corresponding control directly.
  • You need a different dialog for offering value help, such as the select dialog or table select dialog.
  • You use the smart table and your app is performance critical. In this case, the controls offered directly by the smart table offer less flexibility but better performance.
  • You need custom validations.
Important: Keep in mind that the SmartField control, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application. With time, SmartField can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartField only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The binding path expression used to determine the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Important: The SmartField is a metadata-driven control. Avoid direct interaction with the value property, as it should be accessed or modified via the model itself. Note: Composite binding expressions for this property are not supported. Note: Custom formatters for this property are not supported. The SmartField control usually creates its own data type based on the service metadata for the formatting of values. Also, when a custom formatter is specified for a property, the binding mode is automatically switched to one-way binding mode. Note: Named models are not supported, only the default model (named undefined) is supported. For example, when the binding path expression contains a > sign, the string preceding it is a named model and the remainder after the > is the binding path.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab order.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The name of an entity set for which the control manages values. This is an optional property. If this property is left empty, the entity set is computed by parsing the binding context path, for example, Tasks('id-1428419016778-51') is parsed to Tasks.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the control is in display or edit mode. Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:
  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: contextEditable
properties.description: Notifies the control whether controls using the SmartField control are editable.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the text.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: The available text direction options are LTR and RTL. By default, the control inherits the text direction from its parent control. The textDirection property can be used when, for example, the text direction in the application is LTR but you want a specific field to have RTL text direction. Note: The textDirection property is not applicable for the SmartField control for units of measure use cases.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Text shown when no value available.

properties.name: name
properties.description: To be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via 'submit').

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success, Information. Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager. Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text of the value state message popup. Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager. Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: showValueStateMessage
properties.description: Defines whether the value state message is shown or not.

properties.name: jsontype
properties.description: Data types to be used, if the SmartField control is interacting with a JSON model. If the value property of the control is bound to a property of an OData entity set, this property is not taken into consideration.

properties.name: mandatory
properties.description:
Indicates whether user input is required. Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven and this property can be ignored if the following applies:
  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property is annotated with the Nullable annotation. The Nullable annotation is a capability of the OData service that specifies whether a value is mandatory, hence it overrules the control's API settings. Therefore, if the Nullable attribute is specified as Nullable="false", a value is mandatory.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description:
Defines the highest possible number of permitted input characters that the user can enter into the text input field.

Computed maxLength

If the specified maxLength value is greater than the maxLength value specified for the underlying bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property in the service metadata document, the maxLength value of the EDM property takes precedence. Likewise, if the application code provides a binding data type for the value property of the SmartField control and the binding data type has maxLength constraints defined, this maxLength is also taken into consideration to compute the final maxLength value.

Validation Behavior

By design, the SmartField control does not restrict/validate the highest number of permitted input characters for every keystroke, but only when the text input field has changed, and the browser focus leaves the text input field or the ENTER key is pressed. The SmartField control is used more generically in broader contexts, and adding a maxLength attribute to the HTML text input control may break data type formatting in two-way data-binding scenarios. Let's say the maxLength property is set to 3, but the text input control has a formatter function attached to it to format the entered value "DE" to "Germany (DE)". In this case, the formatted value will be truncated by the maxLength setting.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description: If set to true, the suggestion feature for a hosted control is enabled, if the hosted control supports it.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the hosted control, if the hosted control supports this.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: If set to false the label is not displayed.

properties.name: textLabel
properties.description: This property contains the text of an associated SmartLabel.

properties.name: tooltipLabel
properties.description: This property contains the tool tip of the associated SmartLabel control.

properties.name: uomVisible
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is visible. Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:
  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.
Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this property can be ignored if the bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: uomEditable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is in display or edit mode. Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:
  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.
Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:
  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: uomEnabled
properties.description: Enabled state of the unit, if the SmartField control addresses unit of measure use cases, for example, an amount and its associated currency.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Contains a URL which is used to render a link. The link is rendered, if the OData property, to which the value property of the control is bound, is of type Edm.String and the SmartField is in display mode.

properties.name: uomEditState
properties.description: This property is for internal use only.

properties.name: controlContext
properties.description: Defines the context in which the layout of the SmartField control has to be interpreted.

properties.name: proposedControl
properties.description: Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Indicates whether the control break lines (in display mode) to prevent overflow.

properties.name: clientSideMandatoryCheck
properties.description:
Determines if the mandatory check of whether the field has a value happens on the client side - true or on the server side - false. Note: If the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#value} property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property of type different from Edm.String annotated as Nullable="false", the mandatory validation is performed on the client side regardless of the clientSideMandatoryCheck setting. Example: 
    <Property Name="CategoryID" Type="Edm.Decimal" Nullable="false"/>

properties.name: fetchValueListReadOnly
properties.description: Indicates whether the value list collection is fetched in display mode from the resource path specified in the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList annotation. This collection data is used to infer a descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control. However, fetching the value list collection for every SmartField instance individually may not be ideal in some performance-critical scenarios. To optimize this default behavior, you can set this property to false and provide the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation, which is used to specify the URL path name to the Entity Data Model (EDM) property from which the descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control is fetched, for example, LT (Laptop). Note: Setting this property to false only has an effect if the value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String. In addition, applications or frameworks have to make sure the descriptive text is fetched, for example, by expanding a navigation property.

properties.name: expandNavigationProperties
properties.description:
Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request. Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control
Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend. Note: The back-end request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no back-end request since no such data is available.

deprecated.text: It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

properties.name: textInEditModeSource
properties.description:
Sets the source from which text descriptions for IDs are fetched in edit mode, for example, for LT (Laptop). Note: The sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty and sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList enumeration members are only supported if the following applies:
  • The value property of the SmartField control instance is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String or Edm.Guid.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation for the bound EDM property or entity type is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file.
  • The binding mode for the value property of the SmartField control is the two-way binding mode.
  • The field from which the description is fetched is filterable.
Note: In addition, the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty enumeration member is only supported if the following applies:
  • The EDM navigation property association is defined in the service metadata document.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation for the bound EDM property is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file whose Path attribute points to a EDM navigation property of a lookup entity set/type whose single key property is the ID, which contains (among other properties) the descriptive value.
  • The lookup entity must be loaded. The lookup entity can be loaded by expanding the EDM navigation property via a $expand query parameter.
  • The EDM navigation property association defines a referential constraint that ties values of the dependent editable entity type/set to the lookup entity type/set in the service metadata document.
  • The EDM navigation property association end multiplicity of the lookup entity type/set is defined as 1 in the service metadata document. There must be a single-valued navigation from the editable entity set/type to the lookup entity set/type.
  • The lookup entity type/set from which the descriptive value is fetched contains a single-key EDM property.
Note: As of version 1.82, if SmartField is used inside a SmartForm, defaultTextInEditModeSource can be added as custom data to the form and it will be propagated to all smart fields that cover the above criteria. However, if textInEditModeSource is added to the SmartField as property, it will override the defaultTextInEditModeSource propagated from the SmartForm custom data. Note: As of version 1.107 the property will be used to configure the validation for fixed list fields of type ComboBox. The values that will be considered:
  • ValueList - strict validation
  • ValueListWarning - non-strict validation

properties.name: historyEnabled
properties.description: If the property is set to false, history values are disabled. Changes at runtime are not reflected. The historyEnabled property is not applied to custom controls. Note: For {@link sap.m.ComboBox} and {@link sap.m.MultiComboBox} the history values are disabled by default. To enable them for these controls, you need to set the historyEnabled property to true.

properties.name: importance
properties.description: Specifies the importance of the field. Applicable only when the SmartField is used inside SmartForm.

properties.name: fixedValueListValidationEnabled
properties.description: If the property is set to true, a standard validation for {@link sap.m.ComboBox} is performed. An inner control {@link sap.m.ComboBox} is created and the binding is to selectedKey. Changes at runtime are not reflected. Note: This property switches the control in legacy mode. If set to true this will override any setting to textInEditModeSource property regarding ComboBox validation. Note: If the property is set to false, the inner control is {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ComboBox} and the binding is to enteredValue. In this case, any entered value is valid irrespective of whether it's in the predefined list or not. Note: This property is applicable only for fixed-value scenarios.

properties.name: _internalFieldGroupIds
properties.description: Providing value here will overwrite the internally assigned FieldGroupIds calculated from the service metadata. This property accepts comma delimited list of FieldGroupIds.

properties.name: suppressEmptyStringRequest
properties.description: Controls if a query is sent to the backend in case of an empty string.

properties.name: valueHelpTitleSource
properties.description: Controls if the title is taken from the label of the main property or from the label of the value list.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: The content aggregation is used to hold the control that is hosted by the SmartField control.

aggregations.name: configuration
aggregations.description: Optional configuration for SmartField. Note: By default, the value of the displayBehaviour property is not evaluated in edit mode. To enable this feature in edit mode, set the textInEditModeSource control property to a non-default value.

aggregations.name: controlProposal
aggregations.description: Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.

aggregations.name: _ariaLabelInvisibleText
aggregations.description:
Collects the texts to be used for the ARIA labels.
The InvisibleText controls will be added to the DOM by the SmartField control.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

events.name: entitySetFound
events.description: The OData entity set is either derived from the control's binding context or from control's entity set property, if a value for it is specified. In both cases this event is fired.

entitySet.name: entitySet
entitySet.description: The path to the found entity set

events.name: change
events.description: The event is fired after the text in the field has been changed and the focus leaves the field, or after the Enter key has been pressed. Note: This event is fired even if the value of the text input field is subject to data type constraints and the constraints are violated. Also, the invalid value is not stored in the binding/model.

value.name: value

annotations.name: dataType
annotations.description:
Based on the data type the SmartField determines the rendering of the inner control. Additionally the FieldControl is used. FieldControl is an annotation that contains a collection of EnumMembers that can dynamically set the state of the control. Controls used for the SmartField control during runtime are:
  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String without value help.
    Used if control is editable and the EntityType is updatable.
  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String with value help and suggestion list.
    Used if control is editable, the EntityType is updatable, and a ValueHelp annotations exists.

annotations.name: fieldControl
fieldVisible
fieldReadOnly
annotations.description:
Defines whether the field is read-only. In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as read-only with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation. A fixed value can be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember) of the FieldControlType enumeration. XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V4 Service Metadata Document 
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/ReadOnly"/>
   </Property>
In OData V2 models, an EDM property can be statically annotated as read-only with the sap:updatable annotation: XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V2 Service Metadata Document 
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:updatable="false"/>

annotations.name: fieldMandatory
fieldMasked
fieldLabel
fieldText
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. Note: The value must be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation. XML Example of OData V4 Text on CustomerName Property 
<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />
Note: The Path property is mandatory. For OData V2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign a text/description. 
   <Property Name="Customer" type="Edm.String" sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>
Note: If textInEditModeSource is set to None, the Text annotation won't be taken into consideration in edit mode. Note: The Text annotation is not respected in edit mode and dropdown scenario when a sap.m.ComboBox or a sap.m.Select is rendered. For example, when added the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation and set com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues to true, the text will be populated with corresponding value from the ValueList Collection's item. The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement will be applied in both cases.

valueListRelevantQualifiers
valueListWithFixedValues
annotations.description:
If set to true, there's only one value list mapping, and its value list consists of a small number of fixed values. The value list is rendered as a dropdown list containing all possible values. Note: As of version 1.78, value lists with fixed values support the use of the ValueListParameterIn and ValueListParameterOut properties. Note: This annotation is only supported for Entity Data Model (EDM) properties typed as:
  • Edm.String
  • Edm.Guid
  • Edm.Boolean
  • Edm.Byte
  • Edm.Decimal
  • Edm.Double
  • Edm.Float
  • Edm.Single
  • Edm.Int16
  • Edm.Int32
  • Edm.Int64
XML Example of OData V4 Value List on Category Property 
   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues" Bool="true"/>
* For OData V2, the sap:value-list="fixed-values" annotation can be added to the Property. 
   <Property Name="Name" ... sap:value-list="fixed-values"/>
