parameters.description: The column for which to get the clipboard settings

methods.description: Returns the clipboard settings for a column.

methods.name: getCopyProvider
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCopyProvider copyProvider}. Defines an aggregation for the CopyProvider plugin that provides copy to clipboard capabilities for the selected rows of the table and creates a Copy button for the toolbar of the table. To disable the copy function of the table, including the Copy button in the toolbar, the enabled property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. To hide the Copy button from the toolbar, the visible property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. Note: The {@link sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider#extractData extractData} property of the CopyProvider must not be managed by the application. Note: The CopyProvider requires a secure context to access the clipboard API. If the context is not secure, the plugin will not be added, and the copy button will not be generated.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: id of the currently selected variant

methods.description: returns the id of the currently selected variant.

methods.name: getCustomizeConfig

returnValue.description: Value of property customizeConfig

methods.name: getCustomToolbar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar}. A toolbar that can be added by the user to define their own custom buttons, icons, etc. If this is specified, the SmartTable control does not create an additional toolbar, but makes use of this one.
Note:
The CSS class sapMTBHeader-CTX is applied on the given toolbar.

methods.name: getDataStateIndicator
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDataStateIndicator dataStateIndicator}. Defines an aggregation for the DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. If the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator is set to true, the SmartTable control prevents the original behavior of the DataStateIndicator and manages the filtering of binding-related messages. If a user applies or clears message filters, the SmartTable control fires the {@link #event:beforeRebindTable beforeRebindTable} event with the messageFilterActive parameter that is used to determine whether message filtering is active or not. After the binding-related messages have been filtered by the user, all the existing filters, for example, those defined using SmartFilterBar are only taken into account once the message filter has been cleared again. Therefore the message filtering should not be used in combination with a SmartFilterBar. Required additional filters must be added by applications in the {@link #event:beforeRebindTable beforeRebindTable} event.

methods.name: getDeactivatedColumns

returnValue.description: array of column keys

methods.description:
Returns the deactivated column keys.

See {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable#deactivateColumns}

methods.name: getDemandPopin

returnValue.description: Value of property demandPopin

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDemandPopin demandPopin}. The demandPopin attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to display columns as popins on the responsive table Default value is false.

methods.name: getDetailsButtonSetting

returnValue.description: Value of property detailsButtonSetting

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDetailsButtonSetting detailsButtonSetting}. Defines which columns should be hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See {@link sap.m.Column#getImportance} and {@link sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin} for more details. Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true". If no priority is given, the default configuration of {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable#getShowDetailsButton} is used. If this property is changed after the SmartTable has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEditable editable}. This attribute can be used to specify if the controls created by the SmartTable control are editable. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario) Default value is false.

methods.name: getEditTogglable

returnValue.description: Value of property editTogglable

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable}. Specifies whether the editable property can be toggled via a button on the toolbar. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario) Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding}. When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table using the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens just after the initialise event has been fired. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableAutoColumnWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoColumnWidth

methods.name: getEnableCopy

returnValue.description: Value of property enableCopy

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCopy enableCopy}. Enables the copy-to-clipboard functionality of the SmartTable control. When set to true, a {@link sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider} and a {@link sap.m.plugins.CellSelector} are automatically created and added to the SmartTable control if a custom CopyProvider or CellSelector are not already used by the application. When set to false, these created code>CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins are removed again. Note:
We recommend that you set the enableCopy property to false in the following cases:
  • The copy-to-clipboard functionality is not desired
  • Plugins with property settings other than the default ones should be used
  • Only one of the plugins should be used
  • The functionality conflicts with the concrete application scenario, for example, custom columns with special content
  • The functionality conflicts with the known restrictions of the CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins
Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableCustomFilter

returnValue.description: Value of property enableCustomFilter

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCustomFilter enableCustomFilter}. Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.name: getEnableExport

returnValue.description: Value of property enableExport

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableExport enableExport}. Enables the export of data from the SmartTable control to another file, for example, a spreadsheet. If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW, any $expand parameters are removed when sending the request to generate the file.
To use the export functionality, the {@link sap.ui.export} library is required. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnablePaste

returnValue.description: Value of property enablePaste

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnablePaste enablePaste}. Determines whether the Paste button is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEntitySet entitySet}. The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns. Note that this is not a dynamic UI5 property. Note: It is not allowed to have one of the following strings as field names for your OData entity:
  • btnEditToggle
  • btnExcelExport
  • btnFullScreen
  • btnPersonalisation
  • header
  • infoToolbarText
  • persoController
  • toolbarSeperator
  • toolbarSpacer
  • ui5table
  • variant
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getExportType

returnValue.description: Value of property exportType

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getExportType exportType}. Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control. Default value is "UI5ClientPDF".

methods.name: getFilterControlConfiguration
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getFilterControlConfiguration filterControlConfiguration}.

Allows the user to configure filters for the table personalization

methods.name: getFlexConfig
methods.description: Returns the configuration for annotation based flex change delegates.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeader header}.

Specifies header text that is shown in table

methods.name: getHeaderLevel

returnValue.description: Value of property headerLevel

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderLevel headerLevel}. Defines the semantic level of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}. Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getHeaderStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property headerStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderStyle headerStyle}.

Defines style of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitle}.

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization. Note:
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation}. Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI. Note:
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getInitiallyVisibleFields

returnValue.description: Value of property initiallyVisibleFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getInitiallyVisibleFields initiallyVisibleFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
  • If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getInitialNoDataText

returnValue.description: Value of property initialNoDataText

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getInitialNoDataText initialNoDataText}. The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

methods.name: getNoData
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getNoData noData}. The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
Note: If an sap.m.IllustratedMessage control is used without a title set, the SmartTable will automatically update the illustration and text accordingly.

methods.name: getPersistencyKey

returnValue.description: Value of property persistencyKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey}. Key used to access personalization data. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getPlaceToolbarInTable

returnValue.description: Value of property placeToolbarInTable

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlaceToolbarInTable placeToolbarInTable}. Specifies whether the Toolbar control of the SmartTable is placed inside the corresponding aggregation of the inner UI5 table control. Default value is false.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:
  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

methods.name: getSemanticKeyAdditionalControl
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSemanticKeyAdditionalControl semanticKeyAdditionalControl}. Allows users to specify an additional control that will be added to a VBox for the first semantic key field.
Note:
This property is not meant for public use.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectController
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController}.

The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

methods.name: getShowDetailsButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDetailsButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDetailsButton showDetailsButton}. Controls the visibility of the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario. If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area while the columns with Low importance are hidden. On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden. As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowFullScreenButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showFullScreenButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton}. Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowPasteButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showPasteButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowPasteButton showPasteButton}. Controls the visibility of the Paste button. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowRowCount

returnValue.description: Value of property showRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount}. The number of rows is shown along with the header text if the property showRowCount is set to true. Note:
  • To improve your application's performance, activate the inline count for OData bindings to avoid sending dedicated OData requests.
  • If no stable overall count can be retrieved from the binding, the count will not be displayed. This is currently the case for TreeBinding or if no count is requested by the binding.
Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property showTablePersonalisation

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowTablePersonalisation showTablePersonalisation}. The showTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of the TablePersonalisation button. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property showVariantManagement

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement}. The showVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of VariantManagement button. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSmartFilterId

returnValue.description: Value of property smartFilterId

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId}. ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control; When specified, the SmartTable searches for the SmartFilter (also in the closest parent View) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter; to fetch data, show overlay etc. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getSmartVariant
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant}, or null.

methods.name: getTable

returnValue.description: The table instance or undefined

methods.description: Returns the internally used table control. Depending on the concrete scenario, the return type is a sap.m.Table, sap.ui.table.Table, sap.ui.table.TreeTable, or sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable. If the internal table has not been initialized, the function returns undefined.

methods.name: getTableBindingPath

returnValue.description: Value of property tableBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTableBindingPath tableBindingPath}.

This attribute can be used to specify the path that is used during the binding of the table. If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead. (used only if binding is established after setting this property: initially due to enableAutoBinding -or- by subsequently calling rebindTable)

methods.name: getTableType

returnValue.description: Value of property tableType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTableType tableType}. Specifies the type of table to be created in the SmartTable control.
Note:
  • If you add a table to the content of the SmartTable in the view, this property has no effect.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getToolbar

returnValue.description: The Toolbar instance

methods.description: Returns the Toolbar instance used inside the SmartTable control.

methods.name: getToolbarStyleClass

returnValue.description: Value of property toolbarStyleClass

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getToolbarStyleClass toolbarStyleClass}.

A style class which is defined for the toolbar of the table.

methods.name: getUiState

returnValue.description: Current UI state

methods.description:
Returns the current UI state of the SmartTable control.
Note:
The following restrictions apply:
  • Visualizations can only be used to modify the visibility, order, and width of columns, the template or importance of the column cannot be changed
  • MaxItems is not supported
  • RequestAtLeast contains values that are combined from both the SmartTable control property and PresentationVariant annotation, but when it is updated it only affects the internal array. The property in the SmartTable stays the same as before
  • Changes to RequestAtLeast alone will not lead to a new data request
  • RequestAtLeast is not supported in AnalyticalTable scenario
  • Support for column width changes is enabled as of version 1.98.
  • Any other restrictions, like the ones mentioned in {@link sap.ui.comp.state.UIState}, also apply

methods.name: getUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips

returnValue.description: Value of property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips useColumnLabelsAsTooltips}. If no tooltips have been provided, neither by the QuickInfo annotation nor for custom columns directly via property, the column label will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column. To enable this mechanism for custom columns, a sap.m.Label or sap.m.Text must be used as header label. Custom tooltips are not affected by this functionality when they are provided on the column header label for tables of type ResponsiveTable and on the column for other table types. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Value of property useDateRangeType

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseDateRangeType useDateRangeType}. If set to true, all date fields in the Filter Panel of the settings dialog with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval. Default value is false.

methods.name: getUseExportToExcel

returnValue.description: Value of property useExportToExcel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseExportToExcel useExportToExcel}. Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.
Note:
If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW, any $expand parameters are removed when sending the request to generate the spreadsheet.
As of UI5 version 1.56: If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.UI5Client and TreeTable is used, the worksheet.hierarchyLevel property (see {@link sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet}) is filled from the binding, if the relevant information is available there for exporting hierarchical data in the spreadsheet. Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseInfoToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useInfoToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseInfoToolbar useInfoToolbar}. Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:
  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.
Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar useOnlyOneSolidToolbar}. If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style. Default value is false.

methods.name: getUseTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property useTablePersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseTablePersonalisation useTablePersonalisation}. The useTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to define personalized table settings. If you want to persist the table personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property useVariantManagement

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement}. The useVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to use variants. As a prerequisite you need to specify the persistencyKey property. Default value is true.

returnValue.description: the associated SmartVariantManagement control, if any.

methods.description:
Opens the desired panel of the personalization dialog.
Note: Calling this for panels that are globally hidden (E.g. manually by the application, or due to unavailability of functionality) leads to an empty dialog being shown.

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getFilterControlConfiguration filterControlConfiguration}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

returnValue.description: The removed filterControlConfiguration or null

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The copyProvider to set

methods.name: setCurrentVariantId

methods.description: Set the current variant according to the sVariantId. In case an empty string or null or undefined was passed the STANDARD will be set. STANDARD will also be set, in case the passed sVariantId could not be found. In case neither a flexibility variant, nor the content for the standard variant could not be obtained, nor the personalisable control obtained nothing will be executed/changed

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDetailsButtonSetting
parameters.description: New value for property detailsButtonSetting

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDetailsButtonSetting detailsButtonSetting}. Defines which columns should be hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See {@link sap.m.Column#getImportance} and {@link sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin} for more details. Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true". If no priority is given, the default configuration of {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable#getShowDetailsButton} is used. If this property is changed after the SmartTable has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

Default value is false.

This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableCopy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableCopy
parameters.description: New value for property enableCopy

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableCopy enableCopy}. Enables the copy-to-clipboard functionality of the SmartTable control. When set to true, a {@link sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider} and a {@link sap.m.plugins.CellSelector} are automatically created and added to the SmartTable control if a custom CopyProvider or CellSelector are not already used by the application. When set to false, these created code>CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins are removed again. Note:
We recommend that you set the enableCopy property to false in the following cases:
  • The copy-to-clipboard functionality is not desired
  • Plugins with property settings other than the default ones should be used
  • Only one of the plugins should be used
  • The functionality conflicts with the concrete application scenario, for example, custom columns with special content
  • The functionality conflicts with the known restrictions of the CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setEnableCustomFilter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableCustomFilter
parameters.description: New value for property enableCustomFilter

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableCustomFilter enableCustomFilter}. Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sIgnoredFields
parameters.description: New value for property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization. Note:
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sIgnoreFromPersonalisation
parameters.description: New value for property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation}. Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI. Note:
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setInitiallyVisibleFields

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sInitiallyVisibleFields
parameters.description: New value for property initiallyVisibleFields

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getInitiallyVisibleFields initiallyVisibleFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
  • If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setInitialNoDataText

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sInitialNoDataText
parameters.description: New value for property initialNoDataText

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getInitialNoDataText initialNoDataText}. The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Specifies whether the Toolbar control of the SmartTable is placed inside the corresponding aggregation of the inner UI5 table control. methods.name: setRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sRequestAtLeastFields
parameters.description: New value for property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields}. Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:
  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowDetailsButton
parameters.description: New value for property showDetailsButton

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowDetailsButton showDetailsButton}. Controls the visibility of the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario. If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area while the columns with Low importance are hidden. On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden. As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

  • To improve your application's performance, activate the inline count for OData bindings to avoid sending dedicated OData requests.
  • If no stable overall count can be retrieved from the binding, the count will not be displayed. This is currently the case for TreeBinding or if no count is requested by the binding.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.description: New value for property tableBindingPath

If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead. (used only if binding is established after setting this property: initially due to enableAutoBinding -or- by subsequently calling rebindTable) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Sets a new value for property {@link #getTableType tableType}. Specifies the type of table to be created in the SmartTable control.
Note:
  • If you add a table to the content of the SmartTable in the view, this property has no effect.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sToolbarStyleClass
parameters.description: New value for property toolbarStyleClass

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getToolbarStyleClass toolbarStyleClass}. A style class which is defined for the toolbar of the table. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setUiState

parameters.name: oUIState
parameters.description: the new representation of UI state

methods.description:
Replaces the current UI state of the SmartTable control with the data represented in {@link sap.ui.comp.state.UIState}.
Note:
The following restrictions apply:
  • Visualizations can only be used to modify the visibility, order, and width of columns, the template or importance of the column cannot be changed
  • MaxItems is not supported
  • RequestAtLeast contains values that are combined from both the SmartTable control property and PresentationVariant annotation, but when it is updated it only affects the internal array. The property in the SmartTable stays the same as before
  • Changes to RequestAtLeast alone will not lead to a new data request
  • RequestAtLeast is not supported in AnalyticalTable scenario
  • Support for column width changes is enabled as of version 1.98.
  • Any other restrictions, like the ones mentioned in {@link sap.ui.comp.state.UIState}, also apply

methods.name: setUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips
parameters.description: New value for property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips useColumnLabelsAsTooltips}. If no tooltips have been provided, neither by the QuickInfo annotation nor for custom columns directly via property, the column label will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column. To enable this mechanism for custom columns, a sap.m.Label or sap.m.Text must be used as header label. Custom tooltips are not affected by this functionality when they are provided on the column header label for tables of type ResponsiveTable and on the column for other table types. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseDateRangeType
parameters.description: New value for property useDateRangeType

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseDateRangeType useDateRangeType}. If set to true, all date fields in the Filter Panel of the settings dialog with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setUseExportToExcel

returnValue.description: Reference to <code>this<code> in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValue
parameters.description: New value for property useExportToExcel

methods.description: Sets the useExportToExcel property which enables export of data. The export type can be defined using exportType property.

methods.name: setUseInfoToolbar

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sUseInfoToolbar
parameters.description: New value for property useInfoToolbar

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseInfoToolbar useInfoToolbar}. Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:
  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Auto.

methods.name: setUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar
parameters.description: New value for property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar useOnlyOneSolidToolbar}. If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setUseTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseTablePersonalisation
parameters.description: New value for property useTablePersonalisation

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseTablePersonalisation useTablePersonalisation}. The useTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to define personalized table settings. If you want to persist the table personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property. Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setUseVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseVariantManagement
parameters.description: New value for property useVariantManagement

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement}. The useVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to use variants. As a prerequisite you need to specify the persistencyKey property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.TableType
symbols.description:
Provides enumeration sap.ui.comp.smarttable.TableType. A subset of table types that fit to a simple API returning one string.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smarttable.TableType'.

properties.name: AnalyticalTable
properties.description: An analytical table (sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable) control shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists

properties.name: ResponsiveTable
properties.description: A responsive table (sap.m.Table) control that can be used on mobile devices shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists

properties.name: Table
properties.description: A table (sap.ui.table.Table) control shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists (default)

properties.name: TreeTable
properties.description: A tree table (sap.ui.table.TreeTable) control shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists

properties.name: removeFavorite

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement
symbols.description:
Overview

The SmartVariantManagement control communicates with the flexibility library that offers SAPUI5 flexibility to manage the variants.

Usage

You can use this control in combination with the following controls:
  • SmartFilterBar
  • SmartChart
  • SmartTable

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The v2 oData entity set whose metadata is used to create the variant items based on the SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.
Note:This property may be set only once during the initialization phase and may not be changed afterwords.

aggregations.name: personalizableControls
aggregations.description: All controls that rely on variant handling have to be added to this aggregation.

events.description: This event is fired when the SmartVariantManagement control is initialized.

tile.description:
If the property showCreateTile is set, the Create Tile checkbox is shown and its value is passed to this event parameter.
If the property showCreateTile is not set, this event parameter is skipped.

name.name: name
name.description: Variant title. Will be passed for new and for updated variants.

events.name: afterSave
events.description: This event is fired after all changes are successfully stored.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new SmartVariantManagement.
The call sequence is as follows:
A control for which personalization is used has to be registered first via the personalizableControls association. Then it has to call the initialise method with the arguments fCallback function which will be called once the personalization data has been retrieved and oPersoControl, the control itself.
Note: the function callback has to be defined in the personalizable control.
The old behavior, where the control has to register to the initialise event, before the initialise method call, should not be used any longer and is not supported at all for the page variant scenarios. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
references: {@link topic:a8e55aa2f8bc4127923b20685a6d1621 SAPUI5 Flexibility: Adapting UIs Made Easy}

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementAdapter
symbols.description: Handles the odata metadata based information. An instance of this class will be created and used by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement SmartVariantManagement} control. The adapter transforms odata metadata based SelectionPresentationVariant information to UIState object. For each SelectionPresentationVariant annotation an entry will be added to the VariantManagement control. It will be called by the SmartVariantManagement whenever the user selects the corresponding entry and will provide a valid {@link sap.ui.comp.state.UIState UIState} object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementMediator
symbols.description:
Can be used to manage variants. You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for key user adaptation.
Note: On the user interface, variants are generally referred to as "views".

properties.name: defaultVariantKey
properties.description: Provides a string value to set the default variant. Used for the save dialog. Has no effect on the selected variant.

properties.name: displayTextForExecuteOnSelectionForStandardVariant
properties.description:
Defines the Apply Automatically text for the standard variant in the Manage Views dialog if the application controls this behavior.

Note: The usage of this property is restricted to sap.fe components only.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates whether the buttons on My Views are visible.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to enable or disable the control.

properties.name: executeOnSelectionForStandardDefault
properties.description: Determines the behavior for Apply Automatically if the standard variant is marked as the default variant.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description: Semantic level of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates whether the control is in error state. If set to true, an error message will be displayed when the variant is opened.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Sets the maximum width of the control.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description: The name of the model containing the data.

properties.name: selectionKey
properties.description: The key of the currently selected item.

properties.name: showCreateTile
properties.description: Indicates that a Create Tile is visible in the Save As dialog.

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description: Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save As and the Manage Views dialogs.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates whether the functionality of setting a default variant is enabled. The Default column in Manage Views and the Set as Default checkbox in Save View will be disabled if set to false.

properties.name: showShare
properties.description: Indicates that the Public checkbox is visible in the Save As and the Manage Views dialogs. Selecting this checkbox allows you to share variants with other users. Note: this property is controlled by the SAPUI5 flexibility service.

properties.name: standardItemText
properties.description: Overwrites the default Standard variant title. Note: This property has to be set during the applySettings method; it will be ignored otherwise.

properties.name: titleStyle
properties.description: Defines the style of the title. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle}.

properties.name: useFavorites
properties.description: Indicates that the 'Favorites' feature is used. Only variants marked as favorites will be displayed in the variant list.

properties.name: variantCreationByUserAllowed
properties.description: Indicates that end users are allowed to create variants Note: this property is controlled by the SAPUI5 flexibility service.

aggregations.name: variantItems
aggregations.description: Variant items displayed by the SmartVariantManagement control. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control and is populated via the SAP Flexibility service.

aggregations.name: _embeddedVM
aggregations.description: Used for embedded variant managment.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the IDs of the relevant controls for which the variant management is used.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event is fired when users press the Cancel button inside the Save As dialog.

events.name: manage
events.description: This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Views dialog.

renamed.name: renamed
renamed.description: List of changed variants. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and a name (the new title of the variant).

exe.name: exe
exe.description: List of variant keys and the associated Execute on Selection indicator. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and an exe flag describing the intention.

fav.name: fav
fav.description: List of variant keys and the associated favorite indicator. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and a visible flag describing the intention.

contexts.name: contexts
contexts.description: List of variant keys and the associated contexts array. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and a contexts array describing the contexts. Note: It is only used internally by the SAPUI5 flexibility layer.

events.name: save
events.description: This event is fired when the Save View dialog or the Save As dialog is closed with the Save button.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.description: Indicates whether an existing variant is overwritten or whether a new variant is created

key.name: key

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementUi2
symbols.description: The SmartVariantManagementUi2 control communicates with the Ui2 personalization layer to manage the variants.

deprecated.text: replaced by {@link sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement SmartVariantManagement} for smart controls / OData V2 and {@link sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} for OData V4 and freestyle applications.

aggregations.name: personalizableControl
aggregations.description: All controls that rely on variant handling have to be added to this aggregation. The only consumer currently known is the FilterBar control.

aggregations.description: Used for embedded vm

events.name: initialise
events.description: Once the SmartVariantManagementUi2 control has been initialized, and especially after retrieving the variants via the UI2 personalization service and the default variant was applied, the registered consumer will be notified that this phase has completed.

events.description: Fired after a variant is saved. This event can be used to retrieve the id of the saved variant.

events.description: This event is fired when the Save Variant dialog is closed with OK for a variant.

events.description: This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Variants dialog.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDialog
symbols.description:
Overview

The ValueHelpDialog helps the user to find and select single and multiple values. The user can also define and select multiple conditions. The control is generally called from an input field or a multi-input field by clicking the selection icon (value help icon) of the input field. This control only supports OData V2 model (see {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel})

Usage

When to use:

  • The user is searching within a very large dataset
  • The user needs to use different attributes to find an object (such as city, company name, and so on).
  • The user needs to define conditions, such as ranges and exclusions.

When not to use:

  • There is a simpler control that fits the use case. Always start with the least complex control. For example, use the select control if the user needs to select only one item from a short list.

properties.name: basicSearchText
properties.description: Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

properties.name: supportMultiselect
properties.description: Enables multi-selection in the table used.

properties.name: supportRanges
properties.description: Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

properties.name: supportRangesOnly
properties.description: If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

properties.name: keys
properties.description: Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

properties.name: descriptionKey
properties.description: Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

properties.name: maxIncludeRanges
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of include ranges. If value is 0 - the include group of operators should not be displayed.

properties.name: maxExcludeRanges
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges. If value is 0 - the exclude group of operators should not be displayed.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of conditions allowed to be added.

properties.name: displayFormat
properties.description: Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

properties.name: tokenDisplayBehaviour
properties.description: Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

properties.name: filterMode
properties.description: Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

properties.name: _enhancedExcludeOperations
properties.description: Used by the ValueHelpProvider to enable enhanced exclude operations

properties.name: conditionPanelDefaultOperation
properties.description: Sets default operation for Condition Panel of the value help dialog. In case the newly set default operation is not valid for the filter's EDM data type, then it is ignored. expected sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation

properties.name: enabledMultiSelectionPlugin
properties.description: Sets usage of MultiSelectionPlugin. If enabled the default behaviour is changed and the ValueHelpDialog table uses the plugin which provides only "Deselect all" option and the ability for range selection. Also a limit of 200 items that are able to be selected as a restriction. Note: Using MultiSelectionPlugin mode the method update will return a promise.

properties.name: _conditionPanelCalendarWeekSettings
properties.description: Used by the ValueHelpProvider to set calendar week setting to date controls in condition panel

properties.name: _conditionPanelShowCurrentDateButton
properties.description: Used by the ValueHelpProvider to set the showCurrentDateButton property settings to the date controls in the condition panel.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description: Allows you to add a {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar SmartFilterBar} control to the value help dialog.

events.name: ok
events.description: This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.

tokens.name: tokens
tokens.description: The array of tokens created or modified on the ValueHelpDialog.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

tableSelectionParams.name: tableSelectionParams
tableSelectionParams.description: The RowSelectionChange event parameter from the hosted table that contains the selected items.

updateTokens.name: updateTokens
updateTokens.description: Returns an array of objects which represents all selected row tokens. The object contains the token key, the row object data from the model, and the information if the token is selected. [{sKey, oRow, bSelect}, ...]

useDefault.name: useDefault

methods.name: getBasicSearchText

returnValue.description: Value of property basicSearchText

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBasicSearchText basicSearchText}. Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getConditionPanelDefaultOperation

returnValue.description: Value of property conditionPanelDefaultOperation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getConditionPanelDefaultOperation conditionPanelDefaultOperation}.

Sets default operation for Condition Panel of the value help dialog. In case the newly set default operation is not valid for the filter's EDM data type, then it is ignored. expected sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation

methods.name: getDescriptionKey

returnValue.description: Value of property descriptionKey

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDescriptionKey descriptionKey}. Defines the key of the column used for the token text. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getDisplayFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property displayFormat

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayFormat displayFormat}. Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getEnabledMultiSelectionPlugin

returnValue.description: Value of property enabledMultiSelectionPlugin

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabledMultiSelectionPlugin enabledMultiSelectionPlugin}. Sets usage of MultiSelectionPlugin. If enabled the default behaviour is changed and the ValueHelpDialog table uses the plugin which provides only "Deselect all" option and the ability for range selection. Also a limit of 200 items that are able to be selected as a restriction. Note: Using MultiSelectionPlugin mode the method update will return a promise. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFilterBar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getFilterBar filterBar}.

Allows you to add a {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar SmartFilterBar} control to the value help dialog.

methods.name: getFilterMode

returnValue.description: Value of property filterMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterMode filterMode}. Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens. Default value is false.

methods.name: getKey

returnValue.description: Value of property key

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getKey key}. Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getKeys

returnValue.description: Value of property keys

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getKeys keys}.

Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

methods.name: getMaxConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property maxConditions

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxConditions maxConditions}. Defines the maximum number of conditions allowed to be added. Default value is '-1'.

methods.name: getMaxExcludeRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property maxExcludeRanges

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxExcludeRanges maxExcludeRanges}. Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges. If value is 0 - the exclude group of operators should not be displayed. Default value is '-1'.

methods.name: getMaxIncludeRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property maxIncludeRanges

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxIncludeRanges maxIncludeRanges}. Defines the maximum number of include ranges. If value is 0 - the include group of operators should not be displayed. Default value is '-1'.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDialog.

methods.name: getSupportMultiselect

returnValue.description: Value of property supportMultiselect

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSupportMultiselect supportMultiselect}. Enables multi-selection in the table used. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSupportRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property supportRanges

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSupportRanges supportRanges}. Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog. Default value is false.

methods.name: getSupportRangesOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property supportRangesOnly

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSupportRangesOnly supportRangesOnly}. If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature. Default value is false.

methods.name: setTokens

parameters.name: aTokens
parameters.description: An array of token controls

methods.description: Sets the array of tokens. The sap.m.Tokens are added to the dialog tokenizer. Normal tokens are selected in the table. new sap.m.Token({key: "0001", text:"SAP A.G. (0001)"}); Tokens with the extra data with value 'range' are handled as range tokens or exclude range tokens. new sap.m.Token({key: "i1", text: "ID: a..z"}).data("range", { "exclude": false, "operation": sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.BT, "keyField": "CompanyCode", "value1": "a", "value2": "z"}); The selected items or range tokens are returned in the event parameters of the Ok event.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the selection of rows in the table. This function must be called after a first binding or binding update of the table. It will set a table row as selected if a token for this row exists.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation
symbols.description: The range operations supported by the ValueHelpDialog control. This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation'.

properties.name: BT
properties.description: The Between operation for the ranges.

properties.name: Contains
properties.description: The Contains operation for the ranges.

properties.name: EndsWith
properties.description: The EndsWith operation for the ranges.

properties.name: EQ
properties.description: The Equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: GE
properties.description: The Between or equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: GT
properties.description: The Greater operation for the ranges.

properties.name: LE
properties.description: The Less or equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: LT
properties.description: The Less operation for the ranges.

properties.name: StartsWith
properties.description: The StartsWith operation for the ranges.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.variants.EditableVariantItem
symbols.description: The EditableVariantItem class describes an editable variant list item for the Manage Variants popup.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Key of the List Item

properties.name: global
properties.description: Indicator if a variant is visible for all users.

properties.name: lifecyclePackage
properties.description: ABAP Package the variant is assigned. Used for transport functionality

properties.name: lifecycleTransportId
properties.description: Identifier of the transport object the variant is assigned to.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: Variant namespace

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Indication if variant can be changed

properties.name: accessOptions
properties.description: Flags for a variant to indicate why it might be read-only

properties.name: labelReadOnly
properties.description: Indicates if the variant label can be changed

properties.name: author
properties.description: Author of the variant

properties.name: favorite
properties.description: Indicates if favorites can be created.

properties.name: _contexts

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.

properties.name: initialSelectionKey
properties.description: Enables the setting of the initially selected variant.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to enable or disable the control.

properties.name: defaultVariantKey
properties.description: Provides a string value to set the default variant. Used for the save dialog. Has no effect on the selected variant.

properties.name: selectionKey
properties.description: The key of the currently selected item. Returns null if the default item list is selected. This property is calculated when accessing it via the getSelectionKey method. The corresponding setSelectionKey method is not supported. The access via the standard set/getProperty is also not supported.

properties.name: showCreateTile
properties.description: Indicates that a Create Tile is visible in the Create dialog.

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description: Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

properties.name: showShare
properties.description: Indicates that the Public checkbox is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs. Selecting this checkbox allows you to share variants with other users.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates that set as default is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

properties.name: lifecycleSupport
properties.description: Enables the lifecycle support. If set to true, the VariantManagement control handles the transport information for shared variants.

properties.name: standardItemText
properties.description: Overwrites the default Standard variant title.

properties.name: useFavorites
properties.description: Indicates that the 'Favorites' feature is used. Only variants marked as favorites will be displayed in the variant list.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

properties.name: variantCreationByUserAllowed
properties.description: Indicates that end users are allowed to create variants.

properties.name: standardItemAuthor
properties.description: Defines the author of the standard variant, for example, the name of the own company.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items displayed by the VariantManagement control.

aggregations.name: variantItems
aggregations.description: Variant items displayed by the VariantManagement control.

events.name: save
events.description: This event is fired when the Save Variant dialog is closed with OK for a variant.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.description: Indicates if an existing variant is overwritten or if a new variant is created

events.name: manage
events.description: This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Variants dialog.

renamed.name: renamed
renamed.description: List of changed variants. Each entry contains a 'key' - the variant key and a 'name' - the new title of the variant

exe.name: exe
exe.description: List of variant keys and the associated Execute on Selection indicator

events.name: select
events.description: This event is fired when a new variant is selected.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVariantCreationByUserAllowed variantCreationByUserAllowed}. Indicates that end users are allowed to create variants. Default value is true.

parameters.description: Key as proposed by the VariantManagement control.

parameters.name: sNewKey
parameters.description: New key which should be used instead of the sOldKey

methods.description: Replaces the key as proposed by the VariantManagement control with the one as proposed by the control usage.

methods.name: setBackwardCompatibility

parameters.name: bFlag
parameters.description: defines the behavior: false new mode, otherwize 'old' mode.

methods.description:
Defines the internal mode. The VariantManagement is able to support two different modes:
1. the mode with standard entry displayed as 'Default' and
2. the mode with standard entry displayed as 'Standard'.
The 'Default' display is the initial mode.
Note: this method has to be executed, before any items are assigned to the VariantManagement control!

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDefaultVariantKey defaultVariantKey}. Provides a string value to set the default variant. Used for the save dialog. Has no effect on the selected variant. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setSelectionKey

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sSelectionKey
parameters.description: New value for property selectionKey

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectionKey selectionKey}. The key of the currently selected item. Returns null if the default item list is selected. This property is calculated when accessing it via the getSelectionKey method. The corresponding setSelectionKey method is not supported. The access via the standard set/getProperty is also not supported. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.
